items.title: Grab’s guide to AI for marketing success
items.summary:
- Discusses how businesses can leverage AI for effective marketing strategies.
- Highlights various AI tools and technologies beneficial for marketing.
- Provides examples of AI adoption in different companies and sectors.

items.title: Apple raises iPhone exports from India in March
items.summary:
- Apple increased iPhone exports from India to INR 20,000 crore (US$ 2.3 billion) in March 2025, up from INR 11,000 crore (US$ 1.28 billion) year-over-year.
- The rise in exports aims to build inventory ahead of new US tariffs effective April 2, 2025, including a 10% baseline duty and an additional 26% tariff on Indian goods starting April 9, 2025.
- In FY25, Apple’s vendors exported iPhones worth nearly INR 1.5 lakh crore (US$ 1.75 trillion), surpassing India’s total smartphone exports in FY24 of INR 1.3 lakh crore (US$ 1.5 trillion).

items.title: Indian fintech firm Juspay bags $60m series D
items.author: Vimal Kumar, Ramanathan RV, Sheetal Lalwani
items.summary:
- Juspay raised US$60 million in a Series D funding round led by Kedaara Capital.
- Participation from existing investors SoftBank and Accel.
- Funding includes both primary and secondary investment to enhance AI capabilities and improve services.
- Founded in 2012, Juspay specializes in digital payment gateway services and fraud prevention.
- Co-founder Sheetal Lalwani highlighted the commitment to open-source and interoperable payment systems as they expand globally.

items.title: Chic in black: Love, Bonito expected to be profitable in 2025
items.author: Dione Song
items.summary:
- Love Bonito's revenue grew by 37% in 2023, while cutting losses before taxes by 27% year-on-year.
- The brand expects to achieve over US$75 million in revenue and EBITDA profitability by 2025.
- In October 2024, the company laid off 7% of its workforce, including roles in Singapore.
- Love Bonito has expanded regionally, reopening a store in Jakarta and opening a flagship store in Hong Kong in 2023.
- The company entered the Philippines with two new branches in 2024, contrasting with the trend of Singaporean D2C brands favoring development in the US.

items.title: Meet the 15 top-funded startups and tech companies in Vietnam
items.summary:
- Overview of the 15 startups and tech companies in Vietnam that have secured the highest funding.
- Key players in the Vietnamese tech ecosystem are highlighted, showcasing their contributions and achievements.
- Insights into investment trends and the growing interest in Vietnam's technology sector are discussed.

items.title: BYD unveils two high-speed flagship EV models
items.summary:
- BYD reveals two new flagship models: the Han L sedan and Tang L SUV, debuting on Apr. 9.
- Teaser video released on Apr. 6 showcases design and performance advancements.
- Both models feature a new 1000V high-voltage platform for enhanced drivetrain and charging.
- Vehicles can accelerate from 0 to 100 km/h in just over 2 seconds.
- Ultra-fast charging adds 400 kilometers of range in approximately 5 minutes.
- Han L priced starting at ¥270,000 (US$37,300); Tang L starts at ¥360,000 (US$49,700).
- Designed to compete with Tesla’s Model S and Model X in global markets.

items.title: Tether considers US stablecoin for institutions
items.summary:
- Tether Holdings SA is looking to launch a US-based stablecoin targeted at institutional clients.
- The decision is influenced by a favorable regulatory environment and potential changes in US law, including a stablecoin bill in Congress.
- CEO Paolo Ardoino stated they are awaiting the final wording of the bill before proceeding.

items.title: Swiggy faces $885k tax demand over alleged violations
items.summary:
- Swiggy has received a tax demand of $885,000 due to alleged violations.
- The demand is related to the company's operations and financial practices.
- The company is expected to challenge the tax demand through legal means.

items.title: British International Investment backs $10m fund for Indian VC firm
items.author: Vikram Gandhi, Pramod Bhasin, Amit Mehta
items.summary:
- Mumbai-based Asha Ventures secured US$10 million from British International Investment for its debut fund.
- The firm aims to close Asha Ventures Fund-I by September 2025, targeting a US$50 million first close by December 2023.
- Managing partner Amit Mehta stated that fundraising is on track despite rigorous diligence from large institutions.
- Asha Ventures, founded in 2015, invests in companies like Adda 24×7, Vaastu, Avanti, and Nepra.

items.title: Grab’s cab comeback
items.author: Simon
items.summary:
- Grab has re-entered the taxi business in Singapore after securing a license from the transport regulator.
- This move follows a failed acquisition of Trans-cab due to regulatory concerns about competition law.
- With this licensing, Grab becomes the sixth taxi company in Singapore and aims to become a major player in the market.

items.title: EHang gains certification to launch flying taxis in China
items.summary:
- EHang has received certification to operate pilotless aerial vehicles in China, allowing flying taxis to potentially launch in 3-5 years.
- The approval enables EHang and Hefei Heyi Aviation to start commercial services, starting with tourist rides in Guangzhou and Hefei by June.
- EHang's EH216-S model will be used, featuring a two-seater design, 16 propellers, a top speed of 130 km/h, and a range of 30 km.
- The company aims to provide affordable air taxi services in cities like Hefei and Shenzhen to promote adoption.

items.title: 50 rising startups in Vietnam
items.summary:
- The list features Vietnamese startups on the rise that have recently raised funding.
- It includes companies up to the series E funding stage.
- Key details about each funding round are provided.

items.title: Ankur Capital leads $2.9m seed funding in Indian nanotech firm
items.author: Murari Ramkumar, Dr. Nagesh Kini
items.summary:
- Vimano, a Bengaluru-based nanotechnology firm, raised INR 25 crore (US$ 2.9 million) in seed funding led by Ankur Capital.
- This is the first investment from Ankur Capital’s third fund.
- Vimano, founded in 2019, focuses on membrane technologies for energy applications, developing a tunable ion-conductive membrane platform.
- The funding will support pilot projects and enhance workforce and manufacturing processes for its technology.

items.title: Indian markets drop as global sell-off sparks US recession fears
items.summary:
- Indian stock markets opened lower on Apr. 6, 2025, due to global trade tensions and US recession fears.
- Nifty 50 index fell 3.84% to 22,030.25 and BSE Sensex decreased by 3.72% to 72,600.53.
- IT companies dropped 7%, with small-cap stocks down 6.2% and mid-cap stocks down 4.6%.
- Global markets reflected similar declines; MSCI Asia ex-Japan index fell 6.8% and Nikkei 225 down 6.5%.
- Federal Reserve Chair Jerome Powell mentioned potential economic effects of new US tariffs on Apr. 4, 2025.

items.title: S Korea seeks tariff exemptions, unveils $68b auto aid plan
items.summary:
- South Korea's finance ministry announced support measures on Apr. 6 for sectors impacted by US tariffs.
- A 25% tariff on South Korean imports, announced by US President Trump on Apr. 2, takes effect on Apr. 9.
- The auto sector, which made up 27% of South Korea’s $127.8 billion exports to the US last year, is a key focus.
- Financial regulator urged companies to prepare liquidity support for affected exporters and contractors.
- A 100 trillion won ($68.08 billion) market stabilization program launched as the KOSPI index drops to a 17-month low.
- Trade Minister Cheong In-kyo plans to visit the US to negotiate for tariff exemptions.

items.title: Taiwan stock market plunges 9.7% as TSMC slumps
Nintendo shares drop 10% on Trump tariff fears
items.summary:
- Nintendo and Sony shares fell over 10% in Tokyo on April 7.
- Decline was influenced by President Trump's comments on tariffs continuing without trade policy changes.
- This occurs just after Nintendo announced the next-generation Switch 2 console.
- Nintendo postponed US pre-orders for the Switch 2 while evaluating tariff impacts.
- Much of the Switch hardware is produced in China and Vietnam, facing potential tariffs over 46%.

items.title: Toyota to expand EV production to 1m units by 2027
items.summary:
- Toyota plans to increase its electric vehicle (EV) production capacity to 1 million units by the year 2027.
- This expansion is part of Toyota's strategy to meet growing demand for EVs globally.
- The company aims to enhance its competitiveness in the rapidly evolving automotive market, particularly amid increasing regulatory pressure for greener vehicles.

items.title: Horizon Robotics, Volkswagen team up to develop smart driving tech
items.summary:
- Horizon Robotics partners with Volkswagen for advanced driver assistance systems (ADAS).
- Integration of Horizon Robotics’ Superdrive smart driving solution into Volkswagen vehicles.
- Research and development led by Volkswagen’s Cariad unit and the joint venture Carizon.

items.title: Vivo files multiple trademarks for smart headsets ahead of debut
items.summary:
- Vivo has filed multiple trademarks related to smart headsets.
- The filings indicate preparations for an upcoming product launch.
- No specific details about the features or release date of the headsets have been disclosed.

items.title: Google Cloud expands in Malaysia, appoints Hana Raja as country manager
items.author: Not given
items.summary:
- Google Cloud appoints Hana Raja as the country manager for Malaysia.
- She will oversee local strategies for Google Cloud and Google Workspace, reporting to Serene Sia.
- Raja has over 16 years of experience with leadership roles at Cisco and Bain & Company.
- Google Cloud's expansion includes a sovereign cloud initiative, a new data center, and a cloud region in Elmina Business Park, Selangor.
- These efforts are part of a partnership with the Malaysian government to enhance the digital economy.

items.title: Accelerating Asia appoints Zen Rooms co-founder Tanna as mentor
items.summary:
- Accelerating Asia has appointed Tanna, co-founder of Zen Rooms, as a mentor.
- The initiative aims to enhance guidance for startups in the region.
- Tanna brings extensive experience in the hospitality industry to the mentorship role.

items.title: Shein boosts solar power use across China facilities
items.summary:
- Shein is increasing its use of solar power in facilities across China.
- The initiative aims to enhance sustainability practices within the company.
- This move aligns with global trends towards renewable energy in the fashion industry.

items.title: 60/40 Podcast: Startups and VCs in the age of AI
items.author: Prashanth Ranganathan, Peter Bithos, Maria Li
items.summary:
- Discusses how AI is changing both early-stage and late-stage startup building and funding.
- Examines the critical edges founders maintain despite AI advancements.
- Considers the impact of AI-driven startups on VC portfolios and fund economics.
- Updates on fundraising in Southeast Asia and mentions Trump's tariffs.
- Covers acquisition rumors between Grab and GoTo.

items.title: Japan’s Nikkei plunges 8.8% as US-China trade tensions rise
items.summary:
- Japan’s Nikkei 225 index dropped over 2,900 points on April 7, an 8.8% decline, marking its third-largest intraday drop on record.
- The fall was triggered by rising US-China trade tensions and the possibility of a 24% tariff on Japanese goods.
- This decline reflects similar losses in the US market, where the Dow Jones fell 5.5% on April 4, its third-largest one-day drop in history.
- Experts caution that if tariff conflicts persist, the Nikkei may drop below 30,000, further straining Japan’s fragile economy.

items.title: Apple extends TikTok’s App Store stay by 75 days
items.summary:
- Apple will allow TikTok to remain on its App Store for at least 75 more days.
- The decision follows assurances from Attorney General Pam Bondi after a second extension of TikTok's ban deadline under an executive order signed by President Trump.
- TikTok, owned by China's ByteDance, risks a US ban unless its US operations are sold, mandated by a national security law signed by former President Biden in April 2024.
- Bondi indicated that Apple would not face penalties for hosting TikTok during the extended deadline.
- TikTok was previously reinstated on the App Store following similar assurances earlier this year and had gone offline for US users in January.

items.title: Sequoia leads $82m round for French accounting software firm
items.summary:
- Pennylane raised €75 million (US$82 million) led by Sequoia Capital, doubling its valuation to €2 billion (US$2.2 billion).
- Founded in 2020, it serves 4,500 firms and 350,000 businesses in France with accounting tools for SMEs.
- The funds will be used for European expansion, starting in Germany, aiming for product maturity in two years.
- Pennylane projects €100 million (US$109 million) in annual recurring revenue and plans to break even by the end of 2025.

items.title: Delhivery to acquire 99.4% stake in rival logistic firm
items.summary:
- Delhivery, a major logistics player in India, is set to acquire a 99.4% stake in a competing logistics firm.
- The acquisition aims to expand Delhivery's market presence and enhance its service offerings.
- This strategic move reflects the intensifying competition within the logistics sector in India.

items.title: Shipping firm CMA CGM, Mistral AI partner to boost logistics
items.summary:
- CMA CGM has partnered with Mistral AI for €100 million (US$109 million).
- The collaboration aims to enhance customer service in shipping, logistics, and media fact-checking.
- Partnership announced on April 6, 2025; CMA CGM's total AI investment reaches €500 million (US$546.4 million).
- Improvements expected within six to twelve months, although specific financial targets were not provided.
- The move reflects a trend among French firms working on AI amid global trade tensions.

items.title: Taiwanese smartphone lens maker Largan Q1 revenue jumps 29%
items.summary:
- Largan Precision Co. reported a 28.87% year-on-year increase in Q1 consolidated revenue to NT$14.58 billion (US$438.81 million).
- This revenue exceeded forecasts from Capital Investment Management Corp and SinoPac Securities, which estimated NT$14.3 billion and NT$13.77 billion, respectively.
- Revenue saw a decline of 19.4% from the previous quarter's NT$18.21 billion due to seasonal trends.
- Last year's earnings per share were NT$194.17 (US$5.84), the highest since 2019, attributed to advancements in high-resolution camera technology and periscope/telephoto lens adoption.
- Largan is diversifying by exploring lens designs for humanoid robots and factory automation.

items.title: Asian markets plunge as US-China trade tensions rise
items.summary:
- Asian stock markets fell sharply on April 7, following a selloff on Wall Street due to rising US-China trade tensions.
- Japan's Nikkei 225 dropped nearly 8%, closing down 6% at 31,758.28.
- Hong Kong's Hang Seng decreased by 9.4%, closing at 20,703.30, and China's Shanghai Composite declined by 6.2% to 3,134.98.
- South Korea's Kospi fell 4.1%, and Australia's S&P/ASX 200 was down 3.8%.
- China announced retaliatory tariffs on all US imports effective April 10, matching a 34% US tariff on Chinese goods.
- US futures indicated more losses after Wall Street's declines of up to 6% in major indices.
- Oil prices fell, with US crude down 4% and Brent crude down 3.4%.
- The US dollar weakened against both the yen and euro, leading analysts to predict ongoing market volatility.

items.title: Coinbase shares bought for $13.4m by US investment firm
items.author: Cathie Wood
items.summary:
- On April 4, Ark Invest purchased Coinbase shares worth US$13.4 million across three ETFs.
- The ARK Innovation ETF acquired 54,988 shares, totaling US$8.8 million, raising its holdings to US$342 million.
- Other investments included 15,982 shares for US$2.5 million in ARK Next Generation Internet ETF and 12,187 shares for US$2 million in ARK Fintech Innovation ETF.

items.title: Trump defends tariffs as ‘medicine’ for economy
items.summary:
- US President Donald Trump described new tariffs as "medicine" for the economy amid a major drop in global markets.
- Asian stocks and US futures declined sharply due to investor concerns about tariffs of up to 50%, which could lead to higher prices and reduced demand.
- Trump stated that foreign governments must pay significantly to lift the tariffs, which are set to rise from 10% to between 11% and 50% starting April 9, with countries like Taiwan and India seeking negotiations.

items.title: India launches startup helpline to report corrupt practices
items.author: Piyush Goyal
items.summary:
• India’s Commerce Minister Piyush Goyal announced a new helpline for startups to report corrupt practices and bribery.
• The helpline is part of the Startup India initiative and was unveiled at the Startup Mahakumbh 2025 event.
• Startups can use the helpline to suggest regulatory reforms and changes to support innovative technologies.
• The initiative aims to address startup challenges and promote innovation in India's entrepreneurial landscape.

items.title: Indonesian rupiah plunges to weakest level on record
items.summary:
- The Indonesian rupiah fell 1.47% to 16,898 rupiah per US dollar on April 7, marking its weakest level on record.
- The rupiah led declines among Asian currencies, with the Taiwan dollar dropping 0.76%, the Malaysian ringgit falling 0.75%, and the Philippine peso losing 0.74%.
- Other currencies that declined include the South Korean won (0.51%), Thailand’s baht (0.49%), and Singapore’s dollar (0.07%); meanwhile, the Japanese yen gained 0.49% against the US dollar.

items.title: Samsung’s supply chain strained by new US tariffs
items.summary:
- Samsung is facing supply chain challenges due to new US tariffs affecting several Asian countries.
- The smartphone division could see price increases up to 46% for Galaxy smartphones in the US, with production primarily in Vietnam and India.
- Tariffs include 46% on Vietnam, 26% on India, 25% on Korea, and 32% on Indonesia; concerns arise over potential tariff exemptions for Apple.
- Samsung may shift production to Brazil, which has a lower 10% tariff, and increase output in Mexico due to zero tariffs under USMCA.
- Semiconductors are not yet directly affected, but a 25% tariff on chips from outside the US has been threatened, which could increase assembly costs in Taiwan.

items.title: Israeli B2B startup Coho AI shuts down
items.author: Ariel Maislos, Itamar Falcon, Michael Ehrlich
items.summary:
- Tel Aviv-based startup Coho AI has shut down after nearly four years due to revenue struggles, despite raising $8.5 million in seed funding in 2022.
- Coho AI provided analytics tools for B2B SaaS companies but faced competition from established players.
- Yotpo will absorb several Coho employees and cover some shutdown costs; Coho AI is exploring the sale of its intellectual property.

items.title: Taiwan limits short selling after US tariff shock
items.summary:
- Taiwan’s Financial Supervisory Commission (FSC) announced temporary restrictions on short-selling due to US tariffs by President Trump.
- The measures are effective from Apr. 7 to Apr. 11, raising the short-selling margin ratio from 90% to 130% and limiting the number of shares that can be sold short.
- The tariffs are viewed as a source of significant uncertainties for Taiwan’s capital market, with anticipations of pressure on the Taiwan dollar and potential foreign capital outflows.
- Taiwan, a major chip producer, faces a 32% tariff under the new US trade plan. The central bank is ready to use foreign reserves to stabilize the currency if necessary.

items.title: DeepSeek unveils new method to boost AI reasoning
items.summary:
- DeepSeek has introduced a new method to enhance the reasoning capabilities of large language models (LLMs).
- Developed with Tsinghua University, the method combines generative reward modeling (GRM) and self-principled critique tuning.
- The approach improves LLMs' accuracy and efficiency in answering queries.
- A paper published on Apr. 4 on arXiv shows DeepSeek’s GRM models perform competitively against existing public models and align outputs with human preferences.
- DeepSeek plans to open source the GRM models, but no timeline is provided.
- Speculation about the release of DeepSeek-R2, a potential successor to R1, suggests a launch this month, though not confirmed by DeepSeek.

items.title: Fintech firm eToro delays US IPO following market volatility
items.summary:
- eToro, an Israeli fintech company, has delayed its planned US IPO due to market volatility linked to US tariff announcements.
- The company had intended to start its investor roadshow soon but has postponed it indefinitely.
- Other firms, including Klarna, Medline, and StubHub, are also delaying IPOs due to market instability.
- Recent tariff news caused a selloff in capital markets, impacting the S&P 500.
- eToro reported strong financials for 2024, with a net profit of $192 million and revenue of $931 million, mainly from crypto trading.
- The company aims for a valuation of at least $5 billion.

items.title: Mapping India’s fintech key players
items.summary:
- Comprehensive overview of key players in India’s fintech sector.
- Highlights active backers and investment trends in the fintech landscape.
- For more reports, visit [landscape reports](https://www.techinasia.com/category/landscape-reports).

items.title: Malaysia won’t retaliate or face recession over tariffs, PM says
items.summary:
- Malaysian Prime Minister Anwar Ibrahim stated that Malaysia does not expect a recession despite new US tariffs.
- The US tariffs, starting at 10% on April 5 and rising to 24% by April 9, will have some exemptions.
- Anwar emphasized that Malaysia's economic fundamentals remain strong, supported by household spending and tourism.
- Challenges are anticipated for the textiles, furniture, rubber, and plastics sectors, while semiconductor exports are somewhat protected.
- Anwar denounced the tariffs as contrary to WTO principles and refuted claims of a 47% Malaysian tariff on US goods.
- Malaysia will strategically analyze impacts and engage with stakeholders, including US firms.
- The National Geo-economic Command Centre will handle the tariff impact, with plans to depend on regional trade partnerships.

items.title: Taiwan says it won’t retaliate over new US tariffs
items.summary:
- Taiwan's President Lai Ching-te announced no retaliatory tariffs on US goods despite a 32% tariff on Taiwanese products.
- The government will prioritize negotiations and support for affected industries.
- In 2024, 23.4% of Taiwan's exports were to the US, with over 75% going to other markets.
- A negotiation team will pursue a 'zero tariffs' framework like the USMCA.
- Taiwan plans to increase purchases of American goods to balance trade and support SMEs and traditional industries.

items.title: Trump’s tariffs raise costs for US AI, chipmaking gear
items.summary:
- President Trump's new tariffs raise concerns in the US technology sector despite limited exemptions for semiconductors.
- Key items like GPUs and AI training servers remain subject to tariffs, impacting costs.
- Manufacturing equipment essential for chip production is also included in the tariffs.
- Experts warn these tariffs could increase AI hardware costs and hinder infrastructure development.
- High-end GPUs may see price increases, affecting cloud computing and military-grade semiconductor use.
- There are fears of retaliatory tariffs from other countries, complicating global trade.
- The Chips Act's US$52 billion investment might be undermined by rising import costs, as the US's share of global chip production has decreased from 37% in 1990 to 12%.

items.title: Singapore Web3 thrives despite ‘lack of gov’t support’: report
items.summary:
- Singapore’s Web3 sector secured US$742 million in investments in 2024, representing 64% of the fintech industry’s investments.
- The report by the Singapore Fintech Association highlighted a lack of government support, citing high compliance costs and banking access issues.
- The city-state is home to over 300 Web3 firms and 30 active VC firms, but challenges remain, including the need for better regulatory frameworks and awareness of government assistance.

items.title: New Trump tariffs deal ‘massive blow’ to Southeast Asia
items.summary:
- On April 2, 2024, President Trump announced tariffs affecting Southeast Asia, potentially harming its appeal for global business diversification.
- ASEAN nations face tariffs from 10% to 49%, impacting billions in tech exports.
- Vietnam and Thailand are notably affected, with Vietnam's $48.5 billion tech exports facing $22.3 billion in tariffs; Thailand's $24.1 billion faces $8.7 billion.
- The tariffs signal that ASEAN is no longer a viable alternative for circumventing tariffs on China.
- Analysts express concerns that multinational corporations may reconsider foreign direct investment in the region.

items.title: 50 most active investors in Southeast Asian, Indian greentech firms
items.summary:
- Identifies active investors in Southeast Asia and India’s greentech sectors.
- Investors ranked by the number of startups backed in the last 12 months.
- Focus on firms that have supported at least three companies in the specified region and time frame.

items.title: Cash crunch sparks SEA logistics shift
Meet the 50 top-funded startups and tech companies in Japan
items.summary:
- List includes the 50 startups and tech companies in Japan that have raised the most money from investors.
- The funding data only includes information from the past two years.
- Special thanks to East Ventures for assistance in compiling the list.
- Additional links provided for comprehensive databases and research methodology.

items.title: 50 rising startups in Japan
items.summary:
- The article presents a list of Japanese startups that have recently raised funding, indicating their potential as future market leaders.
- The list specifically includes companies that are at the series E funding stage or earlier.
- Tech in Asia provides links to additional resources, including a comprehensive database of tech companies in Asia and their research methodology for tracking startups.
